definition: generic term for pottery
basin/flower pot/unit of volume equal to 12 斗[dou3] and 8 升[sheng1], approx 128 liters/CL:個|个[ge4]
variant of 缽|钵[bo1]
small earthenware plate or basin/a monk's alms bowl/Sanskrit paatra

sentences.english: This is a continuation of the study of the nitrogen availability index of green manure in rice pot experiment.
sentences.chinese: 本文是水稻盆钵试验研究绿肥氮的有效度指标的继续。

definition: to earn
profits pouring in from all sides (idiom)/raking in money/bonanza
both fame and fortune (idiom)/both virtue and reward
to earn a fortune
lit. pile up gold and jade/very rich
treasure bowl (mythology)/fig. source of wealth/cornucopia/gold mine
lit. ten thousand strings of cash in money belt (idiom); carrying lots of money/extremely wealthy/loaded
lit. gold and jade fill the hall (idiom)/fig. abundant wealth/abundance of knowledge
growing plants in pots/Japanese: bonsai
to get rich
small capital, huge profit (idiom); to put in a little and get a lot out
flower pot
riches and honor
to make money
thriving and prosperous business or trade
lit. fill the door/fill the house (at a wedding or auspicious occasion)
